case_vignette: A 23-year-old man comes to the emergency department for 2 days of severe headaches. The pain is most intense on his left forehead and eye. He had similar symptoms last summer. He has been taking indomethacin every 6 hours for the last 24 hours but has not had any relief. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 5 years. He works as an accountant and describes his work as very stressful. Physical examination shows drooping of the left eyelid, tearing of the left eye, and rhinorrhea. The left pupil is 2 mm and the right pupil is 4 mm. There is localized tenderness along the right supraspinatus muscle. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having severe headaches for two days now that are really bad around my left forehead and eye.
Got it. Have you experienced any changes in your vision recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my vision.
Do you have a history of migraines or any other neurological conditions?
I had similar symptoms last summer, but beyond that, I don't have a history of migraines or any neurological conditions that I know of.
Understood. Are you currently taking any medication for your headaches or any other medical conditions?
Yes, I've been taking indomethacin every 6 hours for the last 24 hours, but it hasn't helped.
Do you have any family history of neurological conditions or migraines?
I can't provide any information about my family history of neurological conditions or migraines.
I see. One last question, how old are you?
I am 23 years old.

Thank you for the information. 

**Final Diagnosis:** Cluster Headaches
